channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2023081730
item.description:
Report X-2023081730

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WERE PUT ON AND PACKAGE WAS PUT INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE DECONTAMINATED AND PACKAGE WAS FURTHER PROCESSED.

item.title: Report X-2023081012
item.description:
Report X-2023081012

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: VANCOUVER
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON BELT. PACKAGE HAD A WET SPOT ON THE BOTTOM AND RESPONDER WAS CALLED. RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX AND DISCOVERED THAT A 1 GALLON JUG OF NU-BRITE CONDENSER CLEANER WAS LEAKING FROM CAP. THE JUG WAS IN A PLASTIC BAG WHICH CONTAINED MOST OF THE SPILLED LIQUID. RESPONDER NEUTRALIZED AND CLEANED THE WET SPOT ON THE BELT AND PLACED THE HAZARDOUS MATERIAL INTO A SPILL LINED TRAY.

item.title: Report E-2023080706
item.description:
Report E-2023080706

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPW experienced a UN3266 Temp Det release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting a 10’ x 30’ area of the trailer floor and adjacent freight due to being crushed by other freight. The damaged pail was placed into a 15-gallon poly drum. Three 15-gallon poly drums of UN2984 hydrogen peroxide “MicroTech Liquid Oxygen Bleach” were impacted by the product and stained, each was placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. A baking soda solution was then utilized to neutralize all impacted surfaces. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into to collect all product and neutralizer. The impacted absorbents, impacted cardboard, and rags were collected and containerized into a supersack. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080700
item.description:
Report X-2023080700

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brough to QA due to leaking powder & was immediately placed in a well ventilated area to await further processing. DescribePack: Both internal containers had punctures & abrasions on the side of their packaging. Size = 1 inch. Location = top of sides before neck. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a hazmat lined bin to contain any further leaking powder.

item.title: Report E-2023080738
item.description:
Report E-2023080738

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-23
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver had completed loading his trailer with gasoline. As the driver disconnected the loading hose, one of the lines remained in an open position. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of gasoline to be released. US Ecology responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2023080664
item.description:
Report E-2023080664

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the one metal 275 gallon tote of pathfinder (na1993) had a loose lid and had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023080581
item.description:
Report E-2023080581

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon pails of foam shampoo(3265) had been punctured by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
